<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Config

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.24

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns an array of config entries which meet criteria in condition code. Command iterates through all available config sub classes of the given config class. Current looked at config is stored in _x variable (similar to alternative [[count]] command implementation). Condition has to return [[true]] in order for the looked at config to be added to the resulting array. Slightly faster than [[configProperties]], but doesn't account for config properties or inherited entries.
<br><br><template><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>important</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> 
*The condition code passed to [[configClasses]] should only be used for '''simple filter expressions''' and nothing more
* Do not use <tt>"[[isClass]] [[Magic Variables#x|_x]]"</tt> in the condition. The engine does this check already<br>
<br>
* With ''<template><title>arma3</title></template> v2.01'' specific engine optimisations were added for the following conditions:
** <tt>"[[true]]"</tt> 
** <tt>"[[getNumber]] ([[Magic Variables#x|_x]] >> 'scope') > 0"</tt></value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> condition [[configClasses]] config

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> condition: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> config: [[Config]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - Array of [[Config]]s
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> collect all CfgVehicles configs: <code>_configs = "[[true]]" [[configClasses]] ([[configFile]] >> "CfgVehicles");</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> Return all classes that can transport 10 and more soldiers: <code>_transporters = "[[getNumber]] (_x >> 'transportSoldier') >= 10" [[configClasses]] ([[configFile]] >> "CfgVehicles");</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> Return all classes that inherit from 'RscText': <code>[[hint]] [[str]] ("[[inheritsFrom]] _x == ([[configFile]] >> 'RscText')" [[configClasses]] [[configFile]]);</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[Config]], [[configFile]], [[missionConfigFile]], [[configProperties]], [[configHierarchy]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on oct 19, 2014 - 12:24</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:(Iceman77|Iceman77]]</dt>
<dd class="note"> A fantastic way to filter stuff. eg:
; create an array of west vehicles and spawn then in front of the player in rows of 5
<code>[[private]] ["_cfgArray", "_xPos", "_yPos", "_veh"];

_cfgArray = "( 
	([[getNumber]] (_x >> 'scope') >= 2) && 
	{
		[[getNumber]] (_x >> 'side') == 1 && 
		{ getText (_x >> 'vehicleClass') [[in]] ['Armored', 'Car', 'Air'] }
	}
)" [[configClasses]] ([[configFile]] >> "CfgVehicles");

_xPos = 0;
_yPos = 0;

{
    _yPos = _yPos + 20;
    _veh = [[createVehicle]] [([[configName]] _x), [[player]] [[modelToWorld]] [_xPos, _yPos, 0], [], 0, "None"];
    [[if]] (_yPos >= 100) [[then]] {
        _yPos = 0;
        _xPos = _xPos + 20;
    };
} [[forEach]] _cfgArray;</code>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dd>
</dl>

this will get a list of ALL locations on the currently loaded world
<code>( "true" [[configClasses]] ([[configFile]] >> "CfgWorlds" >> worldName >> "names" ) ) [[apply]] {

		[[getText]] ( _x >> "type" )
	]
